WordPress 3.9.2 is now available as a se
18:
curity release for all previous versions. We strongly encourage you to update your sites immediately.

\n

This release fixes a possible denial of service issue in PH
19: P’s XML processing, reported by Nir Goldshlager of the Salesforce.com Product Security Team. It  was fixed by Mi
20: chael Adams and Andrew Nacin of the WordPress security team and David Rothstein of the Drupal security team. This
21:
is the first time our two projects have coordinated joint security releases.

WordPress 3.9.2 also contains other security changes:

  • Fixes a possib
22: le but unlikely code execution when processing widgets (WordPress is not affected by default), discovered by Alex Concha of the
23:
WordPress security team.\n
  • Prevents information disclosure via XML entity attacks in the external GetID3 library, reported by Iv
24:
an Novikov of ONSec.\n
  • Adds protections against brute attacks against CSRF tokens, reported by David Tomaschik of
25:
the Google Security Team.\n
  • Contains some additional security hardening, like preventing cross-site scripting that could be triggered only by administrators.
26:
>\n\n

We appreciated responsible disclosure of these issues directly to our security team. For more information, see the
27:
sion_3.9.2\">release notes or consult the list of changes.

\n
28: ref=\"https://wordpress.org/download/\">Download WordPress 3.9.2 or venture over to Dashboard → Updates and simply click “Update Now”.</
29:
p>\n

Sites that support automatic background updates will be updated to WordPress 3.9.2 within 12 hours. (If you are still on WordPress 3.8.3 or 3.7.3, you will also b
30:
e updated to 3.8.4 or 3.7.4. We don’t support older versions, so please update to 3.9.2 for the latest and greatest.)

\n

Already testing WordPress 4.0? The th
31:
ird beta is now available (zip) and it contains these security fixes.

\n\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0:{}s:8:\"x

curity release for all previous versions. We strongly encourage you to update your sites immediately.

\n

This release fixes a possible denial of service issue in PH
13: P’s XML processing, reported by Nir Goldshlager of the Salesforce.com Product Security Team. It  was fixed by Mi

15:
is the first time our two projects have coordinated joint security releases.

WordPress 3.9.2 also contains other security changes:

  • Fixes a possib
16: le but unlikely code execution when processing widgets (WordPress is not affected by default), discovered by Alex Concha of the
17:
WordPress security team.\n
  • Prevents information disclosure via XML entity attacks in the external GetID3 library, reported by Iv
18:
an Novikov of ONSec.\n
  • Adds protections against brute attacks against CSRF tokens, reported by David Tomaschik of

the Google Security Team.\n
  • Contains some additional security hardening, like preventing cross-site scripting that could be triggered only by administrators.

We appreciated responsible disclosure of these issues directly to our security team. For more information, see the

sion_3.9.2\">release notes or consult the list of changes.

23:
p>\n

Sites that support automatic background updates will be updated to WordPress 3.9.2 within 12 hours. (If you are still on WordPress 3.8.3 or 3.7.3, you will also b
24:
e updated to 3.8.4 or 3.7.4. We don’t support older versions, so please update to 3.9.2 for the latest and greatest.)

\n

ird beta is now available (zip) and it contains these security fixes.

3: e\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:96:\"WPTavern: Jetpack 3.3 Introduces New Centralized Dashboard for Managing Multiple WordPress Sites\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0:{}s:8:\"xml_
7:
ang\";s:0:\"\";}}s:11:\"description\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:3553:\"

Jetpack 3.3 is now available. The highlight of this release is the new centralized site dash
8:
board feature that allows users to manage multiple Jetpack-connected WordPress sites and WordPress.com sites from one location in WordPress.com.

\n

The new dashboar
9: d is mobile friendly and includes the <a href=\"http://wptavern.com/jetpack-3-2-introduces-centralized-posting-from-wordpress-com\" target=\"_blank\">centralized posting
10:
feature that was introduced in Jetpack 3.2. It also allows users to see all of their sites listed together and perform a number of housekeeping actions:

\n
    \n
11:
• Plugin management: Turn plugins on or off with one click — per site or in bulk.
    • \n
  • Initiate plugin updates: Update plugins f
12:
or a single site or all sites in bulk.
  • Automatic updates: Turn on auto-updates for any plugin on a per-site basis or in bulk.
13: Jetpack 3.3 is required in order to use the plugin management features, so you’ll need to update at least one of your sites to check it out. You also need to activ
14:
ate Jetpack’s JSON API feature and ensure that the “Allow remote actions” setting is enabled.

\n

To view all the plugins you have installed, visit
15: WordPress.com/Plugins. When you click through a plugin, you’ll find a short description of it and
16:
a list of the sites where you have it installed.

\n
18:
s=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35735\" />

\n

WordPress.com’s one dashboard to rule them all is now in direct competition with services like
19: https://managewp.com/\" target=\"_blank\">ManageWP, WP Remote,
20:
lank\">InfiniteWP, and several others that provide centralized site management.

\n

As WordPress has become an increasingly popular solution for building website
21: s, developers are often responsible for more sites than they can safely keep track of for updates. Centralized dashboard management is critical for scaling maintenance c
22:
apabilities. It comes as no surprise that WordPress.com is getting its hook into self-hosted sites by moving to support centralized site management via Jetpack.

\n
23:
In addition to the new centralized dashboard, Jetpack 3.3 also brings many other enhancements to the plugin:

\n
    \n
  • Adds responsive video support to BuddyPress</
24:
li>\n
  • Custom Content Types: Added ‘order’ and ‘orderby’ options to portfolio shortcode
    • \n
  • Display notice when Jetpack Development Mode
25:
is on
  • Compatibility with Twenty Fifteen
  • Likes: Updated the code to accept arbitrary CPTs
  • Related Posts: Allow filter by post_format
    • <
26:
li>Sharing: add new jetpack_sharing_counts filter for option to turn off sharing counts\n
  • Sharing: Use the Site Logo Theme Tool and the Site Icon as fallbacks fo
27:
r image tags\n\n

The 3.3 release also adds several filters that allow developers to further customize Jetpack’s behavior. Check out the
28:
://wordpress.org/plugins/jetpack/changelog/\" target=\"_blank\">changelog for the full list of enhancements and improvements.

\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0:{}s:8:\"xml_b
33: :\"child\";a:2:{s:0:\"\";a:5:{s:5:\"title\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:97:\"WPTavern: 100,000+ WordPress Sites Compromised Using the Slider Revolution Security Vulnera
39: edit: Ravages - cc\" class=\"size-full wp-image-27206\" />photo credit: Ravages –
40:
ttp://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/2.0/\">cc\n

Over the weekend, the security team at Sucuri
41: promises-100000-wordpress-websites.html\" target=\"_blank\">discovered that more than 100,000 WordPress sites have been hit with the SoakSoak.ru malware campaign. Th
42:
is campaign has resulted in more than 11,000 domains being blacklisted by Google.

\n

SoakSoak modifies the wp-includes/template-loader.php file in order to inject J
43: avascript, which contains the malware, into every page on compromised sites. You can check to see if your site is affect

0: ure implementation. Parbs is most excited about the idea of “blueprints,” which would offer the ability to install themes and plugins while setting up a new
1:
site.

\n

A blueprint would define a list of plugins, themes, mu-plugins, and various site options. When installing, you could grab that blueprint and it
2: would set it all up. I’m planning on letting you grab from Github, WP.org, a zip file link, etc. I’ve <a href=\"https://github.com/bradp/vv/issues/5\" targe
3: t=\"_blank\">outlined the idea on GitHub. You’d setup multiple blueprints, and when you do an install, you could grab a blueprint and use that. For example, an
4:
‘ecommerce’ blueprint might install WooCommerce, some other plugins, and _s, or whatever you like.

\n

As the VVV Site Wizard doesn’t
5: seem to be maintained anymore, Parbs plans to keep Variable VVV going and has also outlined a number of other enhancements in the project’s <a href=\"https://gith
6:
ub.com/bradp/vv/issues" target="_blank">issues queue:

  • Enable vv to auto-update itself
  • Add deployment capability
  • Delete site dat
7:
abase during removal
  • Add option to add dummy content when creating site
  • Allow overriding of /htdocs install location

    • Parbs plans to a
8: dd anything that will make developers’ lives easier at WebDevStudios, but he is also open to suggestions. “I’ve built the script to be extremely easy t
9:
o add new functionality, so implementing features people request will be as easy as possible,” he said.

\n

The script is now ready for public use. “Over
10: the past few days, a few people here at WebDevStudios have been beta-testing it, and its really solid,” Parbs said. <a href=\"https://github.com/bradp/vv\" target
11: =\"_blank\">Variable VVV is now publicly available on GitHub for anyone who wants to use it or contribute back to the project. If you test the script, make sure to l
12:
eave your feedback and suggestions in the project’s issues list, as WebDevStudios plans to consistently maintain and extend the tool to make it better.

\";s:7:\
17: :0;s:8:\"xml_lang\";s:0:\"\";s:5:\"child\";a:2:{s:0:\"\";a:5:{s:5:\"title\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:77:\"WPTavern: Idea Factory: A Frontend Submission and Voting Sy
23:
actory\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35420\" />

\n

One of the oldest and simplest ways of accessing public opinion is through an up/down voting syste
24:
m. When offered in a controlled setting where everyone has the chance to vote, the system causes the best ideas to float to the top.

\n
25: org/plugins/idea-factory/\" target=\"_blank\">Idea Factory is a plugin designed to make it easy for WordPress administrators to set up a voting system where users ca
26: n submit new ideas from the frontend. The plugin was created by Nick Haskins, author of the
27:
rdpress.org/plugins/aesop-story-engine/\" target=\"_blank\">Aesop Story Engine.

\n

“Idea Factory was born out of necessity, and the frustration of
28: the lack of plugins that did exactly what I wanted it to do,” Haskins wrote in the plugin’s description. His implementation is simple but built to
29: be extensible, offering developers a number of filters, hooks, and actions. Idea F
30:
actory features the following:

  • AJAX powered front-end submission and voting
  • Voting is limited to logged-in users
  • 1 vote allowed per us
31:
er per idea
  • Emails the admin with notification of a new submission
  • Extensible with hooks and actions on events
  • More ideas loaded with AJAX
32:
on front-end
  • Mobile friendly

    • Logged-in users can enter new ideas via a modal submission box. The plugin creates an Idea custom post type and da
33:
ta is stored in post_meta and user_meta tables.

\n

<
35:
/>

\n

Ideas are displayed at yoursite.com/ideas. Users can only vote once on each idea before they are locked out. Up votes push ideas to the top and down votes
36:
send ideas further down the list.

\n
37:
.wp.com/wptavern.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/ideas.png?resize=1025%2C537\" alt=\"ideas\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35432\" />

\n

The design is g
38: eneric enough to drop nicely into any theme, but you can further customize it by copying the file from the plugin’s /template-ideas/ directory into your theme. Ide
39:
a Factory’s settings also allow you to disable the core CSS file from loading so that you can take full control.

\n

Each idea and its description can be edite
40: d in the admin. If you have a highly active voting board, you may want to turn off email notifications for new submissions. The settings also include an option to hold a
41:
ll new ideas as drafts to be approved before publishing.

\n

After testing Idea Factory, I was impressed with how easy it was to set up and use. Both idea creation a
42: nd voting are anonymous, but it might be nice to have an option to display users for each. However, one of the best things about Idea Factory is that it maintains a limi
43:
ted set of features in favor of keeping the plugin lean and extensible.

\n

An idea voting system can help community managers or

0: ttps://buddypress.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/3460\" target=\"_blank\">ticket that houses the discussion on this issue has been open for three years. BuddyPress 2.2 fi
1:
nally answers this request and gives plugin developers a beautifully simple implementation for adding post type support to the activity stream.

\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0
6: g\";s:0:\"\";s:5:\"child\";a:2:{s:0:\"\";a:5:{s:5:\"title\";a:1:{i:0;a:5:{s:4:\"data\";s:109:\"WPTavern: New Plugin Adds Google’s No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA to WordPress Login
11: are starting to spring up in the WordPress Plugin Directory to bring Google’s new No Captcha reCAPTCHA to WordPress forms. With public hatred for CAPTCHAs at an al
12: l-time high, Google finally put its efforts into redesigning the experience, <a href=\"http://wptavern.com/googles-new-recaptcha-api-replaces-distorted-text-with-a-check
13:
box\" target=\"_blank\">replacing the distorted text with a simple checkbox.

\n
14: rel=\"prettyphoto[35201]\">
16:
ogle Online Security Blog\n

WordPress developers have been quick to take advantage of the new No CAPTCHA API to add it to WordPress forms. So far, the
17: tps://wordpress.org/plugins/no-captcha-recaptcha/\" target=\"_blank\">No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA plugin, created by Nigerian web developer
18:
rget=\"_blank\">Agbonghama Collins, provides the most flexibility for specifying the forms where you want to add the protection.

\n
    \n
  • Option to activate CA
19:
PTCHA in either login, registration, comment or combination of two or all\n
  • Choose a theme for the CAPTCHA (light or dark)
    • \n
  • Auto-detects the user’
20:
s language

Once activated and configured, you’ll see the new reCAPTCHA added on the frontend:
22:
ze=359%2C459\" alt=\"recaptcha-frontend\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35276\" />

\n

The plugin is easy to configure – simply paste in your Goog
23:
le reCAPTCHA keys on the settings page:

\n
25:
/>

\n

Select the login, registration, or comment forms, or any combination thereof, for adding No Captcha reCAPTCHA protection.

\n
27:
png?resize=725%2C324\" alt=\"select-form\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-35275\" />

\n

Further down the page you have the option to force the plugin to
28: use a specific language via a dropdown, or leave it on auto-detect. You can also set a custom error message for when the user fails to solve the CAPTCHA and select a th
29:
eme for the CAPTCHA display.

\n

I tested the plugin and it works as advertised to add the new No Captcha reCAPTCHA. I discovered that it is not compatible with the
30: Jetpack Comment module, so you’ll want to uncheck that box for comments if you’re using it. The <a href=\"https://wordpress.org/plugins/no-captcha-recaptcha/
31: \" target=\"_blank\">No CAPTCHA reCAPTCHA plugin is available for free from WordPress.org. It’s not yet known whether Google will create an official implementa
32:
tion for WordPress, but in the meantime, this plugin makes it easy to add reCAPTCHA to the WordPress forms that are the most vulnerable to spam.

43: ads. Download Monitor provides an interface for uploading and managing down

0:
ats\" target=\"_blank\">Flounder theme.

\n

Minnow features a single-column blog homepage, with a prominent social links menu at the top. The theme has support f
1:
or all the standard post formats, with unique grey icons for each. The post meta design is tastefully simple and understated so that your content stays in focus.

\n
3:
014/12/minnow.png?resize=1025%2C993\" alt=\"minnow\" class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-34912\" />

\n

Quotes, galleries, asides, etc. are all uniquely repre
4:
sented with subtle variations. Minnow also includes matching styles for threaded comments.

\n
6:
ze-full wp-image-35063\" />

\n

The theme has just a handful of customization options for changing the background image and/or color. It’s the type of them
7:
e that you can activate and have it looking like the demo in under two minutes.

\n

The theme is mobile friendly, and the 660px main content area sizes down graceful
8:
ly for mobile devices. Minnow also includes a slide-out sidebar widget area. The primary navigation menu is pinned to the top of the sidebar, above any widgets.

\n
9: Check out the live demo to see Minnow in action. You’ll have to install the theme on your site i
10:
n order to see the slide-out sidebar and navigation menu, as it is currently omitted in the demo.

\n

If you’re looking to jump start your blog for the upcomin
11: g new year, Minnow is an excellent choice. The clean design offers visitors a pleasant reading experience. <a href=\"https://wordpress.org/themes/minnow\" target=\"_blan
17: avern: Roots Starter Theme for WordPress Will Become Framework Agnostic in 2015\";s:7:\"attribs\";a:0:{}s:8:\"xml_base\";s:0:\"\";s:17:\"xml_base_explicit\";b:0;s:8:\"xm
22: /2014/12/roots.jpg?resize=1024%2C477\" alt=\"photo credit: Buzz Hoffman - cc\" class=\"size-full wp-image-35036\" />photo credit:
23:
otos/buzzhoffman/3673683967/\">Buzz Hoffman – cc\n

Major changes are coming to the
24: \"http://roots.io/\" target=\"_blank\">Roots starter theme for WordPress. Roots has appealed mainly to developers, because it incorporates modern build tools into it
25:
s workflow. The theme was first released in 2011 and now counts more than 70 contributors to the project.

\n

Roots currently utilizes HTML5 Boilerplate, Bootstrap,
26: Grunt, and Bower in the starter theme but will will soon be moving to Gulp. The project’s GitHub repo has a <a href=\"https://github.com/roots/roots/pull/1138\" t
27:
arget=\"_blank\">Gulp branch with the relevant discussion and commits.

\n

“Gulp is faster, has nicer configuration files, allows us to easily comp
28: ile both Less and Sass to the same stylesheet, and more,” Roots creator Ben Word said, regarding the
29:
upcoming changes.

\n

This will also include an update to Roots’ asset pipeline, which will allow theme developers to take CSS and JS from WordPress plugins a
30: nd have it compiled into the single CSS and single JS files that the theme builds. The <a href=\"https://github.com/roots/roots/pull/1215\" target=\"_blank\">new asset p
31:
ipeline brings changes to project folders, removes differences between dev and production tasks, and adds a JSON-based asset pipeline.

\n

Build a Roots-based T
32:
heme Using Any Framework\n

Additionally, the starter theme will be moving away from including Bootstrap
33: in order to become framework agnostic. “We’re going to have a Yeoman generator that will allow you to build a Roots based theme however you want,” Wor
34:
d said. “You’ll be able to pick from any framework, Bootstrap, Bootstrap Sass, Foundation, and more.”

\n

While Bootstrap still has a very large us
35: er base, the Roots community has shown more interest in other frameworks such as Semantic UI and
36:
s://developers.google.com/web/starter-kit/\" target=\"_blank\">Google’s Web Starter Kit.

\n

“A lot of people over the years have expressed that they
37: like Roots, but don’t like Bootstrap,” Word explained. “We’ve even seen some forks pop up (Roots Foundation, for instance) to accommodate other framew
38:
orks. By becoming framework agnostic, the starter theme should be able to appeal to a wider audience.”

\n

Word and his team plan to have the generator ready f
39:
or the public in the first quarter of 2015 and are currently working to incorporate work from other Yeoman generators.

\n

Last year, the Roots community introduced
40: Bedrock, a modern WordPress stack that uses Composer for managing WordPress along with Capistrano for
41: deployment. Bedrock can be used with any theme. Since its launch, the project has struggled with branding issues. When all the new changes are merged into Roots’ m
42:
aster branch, Word plans to rename the starter theme and keep Roots as the organization name.

\n

The Roots starter theme has always had a somewhat narrow audience d
43: ue to the fact that it

0: os para atingir os objetivos e metas traçados mediante à proposta curricular.\r\n\r\nDiante dessa realidade, as instituições de ensino não só estão incentivando cada vez
1: mais o uso de novos recursos tecnológicos, ferramentas e plataformas educacionais em sala de aula, como também estão investindo fortemente na formação do educador e na
2:
ampliação de seus conhecimentos tecnológicos.

Formação de educadores
Com o objetivo de ajudar professores e gestores de redes públicas de ensino a se apropriar
3: em das ferramentas e conteúdos e incorporarem as tecnologias educacionais à sua rotina escolar, no planejamento de aulas com os alunos, a Divisão de Tecnologia Educacion
4: al da Positivo Informática desenvolveu o “Projeto de formação de professores e gestores para inserção de tecnologias educacionais em redes públicas de ensino”.\r\n\r\nDe
5: senvolvido por uma equipe multidisciplinar, o projeto é planejado em conjunto com as Secretarias de Educação dos Municípios onde é implementado e pode ser realizado de f
6: orma presencial ou à distância. Já a formação dos docentes é realizada por profissionais com habilidades didáticas e experiências técnico-pedagógicas de uso das soluções
7:
de tecnologia educacional, que conhecem a realidade das escolas envolvidas no projeto.

Resultados
Desde 1997, o projeto já formou 47.500 professores na modali
8: dade presencial, somando aproximadamente 155.300 horas de formação realizada. Na formação a distância, são disponibilizados cursos no ambiente virtual de aprendizagem da
9: Rede do Educador. No período de 2010 a 2014, foram ofertados 26 cursos, envolvendo 226 turmas e capacitando 7.376 professores e gestores de escolas públicas inscritas.\
10: r\n\r\nProfessor, clique aqui para saber mais sobre a Rede do Educador.','A tecnologia como prática pedagógica e a importância da formação do educador','','inherit','ope
22: =acf&p=219',0,'acf','',0),(220,2,'2014-12-22 16:41:50','2014-12-22 18:41:50','Projetos bem-feitos, componentes de qualidade e uma equipe competente são os fatores de suc
23: esso da Positivo Informática\r\n\r\nCom o objetivo de ajudar a melhorar a vida das pessoas através do acesso à tecnologia, aproximando quem está longe, conectando quem e
24: stá perto, expandindo os sentimentos e renovando as experiências, há 25 anos a Positivo Informática se dedica ao desenvolvimento de produtos inovadores que combinam alta
25: tecnologia e preços acessíveis. Do total, 20 anos também foram de expansão na área de Tecnologia Educacional e, há 10 anos, a empresa é líder na venda de computadores n
26: o Brasil.\r\n\r\n“Estamos muito felizes, porque a empresa tem 25 anos e passou 10 deles sendo a líder na venda de PCs no Brasil. A Positivo pode se orgulhar de ser uma d
27: as poucas empresas dessa área que é líder de vendas no seu próprio país”, comemora Hélio Bruck Rotenberg, presidente da Positivo Informática, em entrevista à Exame.com,
28: publicada em 15/12/14.\r\n\r\nMas qual a fórmula para todo esse sucesso? Hélio atribui os excelentes resultados da empresa a três fatores: projetos bem-feitos, component
29: es de qualidade e uma equipe competente. “Apesar de trabalharmos com preços baixos, não somos os mais baratos do mercado. Para manter o preço competitivo sem perder qual
